data:
• 2 teachers training in language and methodology to embed the target language into School
• Help School follow new national curriculum
• Find partners abroad 
• Get pupils to use ICT to communicate with other schools in UK and abroad.

Bakgrund till detta projekt är att vi lever i en allt mer globaliserad värld där kunskaper om andra kulturer, språk och social kompetens är en nödvändighet.  Därför vill vi ge våra elever möjlighet till praktik i andra länder. En fördjupad förståelse kräver mer personliga möten mellan ungdomar från olika länder, vilket kan ske i skolsammanhang eller i arbetslivet. I dessa möten växer förståelse för att människor utifrån olika erfarenheter, olika sätt att värdera och tänka bygger samhällen olika. Vi har valt England och Lettland därför att vi har goda kontakter sedan många år tillbaka med stora hotell och butiker samt ett barnhem i Lettland. Eleverna möter en vardag som de inte har erfarenhet av i Sverige. 



Syftet är att vi vill uppmuntra och göra det möjligt för elever som p.g.a. ekonomiska eller av sociala skäl inte har möjlighet att få denna erfarenhet som det innebär att åka utomlands och möta andra kulturer, samhällsskikt och andra sociala kontexter. Ytterligare ett syfte är att vi vill att eleverna ska lära sig möta människor i andra kulturer, lära sig deras seder och bruk samt tillgodogöra sig engelskan på ett djupare, bredare och mer professionell nivå, helst bli ”native speaker”.

I examensmålen för Handel- och administrations programmet betonas att eleverna ska utveckla förmåga att hantera det personliga mötet i olika sammanhang. Attityder, värderingar och förhållningssätt påverkar försäljnings- och servicesituationer därför vill vi ge våra elever möjligheter ökad kunskap för ovannämnda område. Service och kommunikation innebär kontakt mellan människor och länder.



Barn och fritidsprogrammets examensmål betonar möte mellan människor och eleverna skall ges möjlighet att reflektera över och diskutera sociala och kulturella frågor.



I Restaurang- och livsmedelsprogrammet examensmål finns en stark internationell prägel därför ska kunskaper om livsmedel och måltider i andra kulturer ingå i utbildningen eftersom branschen är en del av en internationell arbetsmarknad.



Deltagare

Vår önskan är att ca 40 elever från årskurs 2 och 3 från Holavedsgymnasiet ska kunna deltaga i detta projekt under en två-års period. De elever som kommer i fråga till detta projekt ska ha visat hög social kompetens och social mognad. Våra mottagarorganisationer i England och Lettland är, Randolph Macdonald hotels, Malmaison hotels, Primark, Marks & Spencer och Childrens village of Grasi där vi har vi goda och professionella kontakter sedan många år tillbaka. 



Genomförande 

Eleverna kommer att praktisera i tre-fem veckor per period p.g.a. att skolan har sina praktikperioder utlagda i intervall som infaller under V.45-49 i åk3, V.8-12 i åk 3, samt V.17-21 i åk 2 med början under hösten 2014. Tre veckors praktik för BF-eleverna på barnhemmet p.g. a. avnämarens rekommendationer med anledning av elevernas unga ålder och den psykiskt tunga verklighet eleverna möter i Lettland under sin APL-period.



Beskrivning av APL/aktiviteter

Englands kultur har påverkat så många andra i hela världen. Engelskan är ju också det viktigaste språket att behärska idag.

Att möta engelsk och internationell mat-, service- och handelskultur och få inblick i den samt hur man bedriver service i ett internationellt perspektiv är mycket värdefullt för våra RL- och HA-elever. 



På barnhemmet ska eleverna träna sitt pedagogiska ledarskap genom att planera, genomföra och utvärdera pedagogiska aktiviteter. Eleverna ska också reflektera och jämföra levnads- och uppväxtvillkor enligt Maslows och Bronfenbrenners teorier. Ett annat kunskapskrav är att eleverna skall observera pedagogiska förhållningssätt och metoder utifrån deras erfarenheter och kunskaper från Sverige.



Förväntat resultat och önskvärda effekter

Ett högt prioriterat resultat för samtliga deltagande program är att eleverna ska få fördjupad kunskap i engelska språket, internationella och globala erfarenheter. Elever från andra ekonomiska och sociala bakgrunder ska få möjlighet att ta del av internationella och mångkulturella miljöer. Vår önskan är att eleverna ska få en högre anställningsbarhet och en tydlig yrkesidentitet enligt examensmålen för programmen. Efter avslutad gymnasieutbildning och med denna erfarenhet  av arbete  utomlands är vår förhoppning att eleverna skall öka sin mobilitet inom EU  och söka sig utomlands för arbete.



Långsiktighet

Vårt projekt ska även fungera som ett pilotprojekt på vårt gymnasium, så att alla elever på våra yrkesprogram i framtiden ska kunna erbjudas denna möjlighet. En intressant och givande utbildning på gymnasienivå är avgörande för en relativt liten kommun som Tranås (drygt 18000 invånare). Det här bidrar till att göra Holavedsgymnasiet bättre och därmed mer attraktivt för elever att söka. 

Vår önskan är att våra elever ska utveckla ett entreprenöriellt förhållningssätt, våga utmana sig själv i sin personliga utveckling, få motivation till högre studier och på så sätt får vi eleverna på Holavedsgymnasiet att ta ansvar för sitt eget livslånga lärande.
Better Together - Wenn Anderssein normal ist

As it has been outlined in the theme and objectives of the project the inclusion of young people with and without disabilities is a unique point of this exchange.  By bringing young people with and without disabilities together in a social setting, the project aims to counter segregation and marginalisation. The activities support a breakdown of these barriers and it offers the youngsters a unique place to meet and to get to know each other and eventually act as a group. Strong relationships should have developed by the time the excursion comes to an end. Moreover, they can dive into other cultures. The project helps young people to understand each others’ cultures and habits. They also learn about history, different culture and current politics in a unique environment. Young people are expected to develop a better awareness of the Scottish, Italian and German culture, challenging previously held misconcepts and stereotypes, hence to develop tolerance. They will acquire skills and competences that are not only important when living and working with people with special needs but are also beneficial when living in a diverse society with a variety of different needs. It is expected that young people will break down both personal and social barriers which in turn will build confidence and self-esteem. Maturity and a sense of independence is expected to develop in the young people. 
We want to intensify the established exchange and integrate new participants from all three countries. The new participants and staff are valuable to this exchange as they can enrich this project with new innovative ideas, experiences and talents. Young people with various disabilities or youngsters with fewer opportunities or those from a socioeconomically disadvantaged background and young people without disability from all three countries will get to know each other in experiential education and cultural education based activities. In this informal learning environment they will explore their physical and mental limits. It also promotes intercultural learning that teaches all participants about Germany's history, language, politics and culture. In this exchange we want to experience a united Europe and enable everyone regardless of their problems or handicap to share this experience with us. Furthermore, we aim at enthusing the young people for this period and encouraging them to think outside of the box.
This will broaden their horizons and show them the various possibilities they have in the future.

The project we are applying for is an LFEE French one week immersion course to provide training for primary school teachers across Europe. The aims of the project are detailed below;To improve methodological expertise in the teaching of French to young learnersTo provide participants with materials and ideas suitable for the teaching of French at primary levelTo develop cultural awareness and understanding of contemporary FranceTo improve participants’ competence and performance in FrenchTo use Internet and other ICT resources in your class(source: LFEE.net)We feel this project would be beneficial for our school because;- More staff will be trained in effective teaching of modern languages bringing about greater confidence- We will make strong connections with our European colleagues resulting in ongoing relationships to the benefit of both parties- We will be better equipped with physical resources and also a wider array of ideas to support all learners across all ages and stages within primary school- We will be confident in delivering the 1 plus 2 languages and integrating French into daily classroom life- We will share ideas in our own establishment and within our local cluster and community e.g. French Cafe in school hall- We will take suggestions from other schools. In particular, our French twinned school; St Nazaire.- We will have a developed understanding of European culture and will use this in our teaching practice- It will further implement the 1 plus 2 language approach as outlined by Curriculum for Excellence- It will raise awareness of European culture in a variety of ways- It will improve language proficiency amongst pupils and staff- It will broaden our knowledge of resources beneficial for our classroom environment- It will improve the use of ICT within French language teaching- It will  deeply enhance the early, first and second level teaching experiences across the school- It will allow us to more confidently teach, model and observe French lessons- It will allow us to build on knowledge already received from PLL course- We will make effective use of ICT opportunities such as Language Nut and Duolingo To summarise, we feel that we would be ideal candidates for the LFEE French Immersion course. We are enthusiastic about developing our French language and improving our competency and confidence in teaching French. We are excited to experience French and European culture first hand and we look forward to this project being a continuation of our learning journey.

Break the Mould is the continuation of a tri-national youth exchange project involving groups from Scotland, Germany and Italy with the remit of bringing young people with and without disabilities together in a residential setting for  a period of 10-days.Break the Mould is about breaking barriers, kicking habits and doing things in a different way that challenge young people to become more mature and responsible individuals.  The core objectives of the project are to break down personal and social barriers to participation in local and European society, develop self confidence and life skills such as language, communication and leadership, and to prevent personal isolation of participants that can occur through disability, bullying and even geography.The exchange is based in a modern accessible facility named the Conforti Institute located in the town of Coatbridge just outside the city of Glasgow in Central Scotland and takes place in the month of August 2016.34 young people accompanied by 15 staff will participate in the excursion.  Activities and the implementation method vary in scope.  Group projects such as getting to know you games and independent living workshops will be facilitated by leaders to  encourage interaction, boost confidence and promote team building; visiting sites like the banks of Loch Ness, exploring the old town in the city of Edinburgh and touring a whisky distillery will take an informal approach to exploring Scotland's rich history and culture; participants will be physically challenged by climbing up waterfalls and jumping into massive plunge pools whilst traversing a gorge, adding a splash of fun to a truly amazing project.

As a result of the Scottish Government's new policy 'Language Learning in Scotland: A 1+2 Approach' which will be fully implemented by 2020,  Simpson Primary School has initially enlisted the assistance of two teachers to participate in a SLC/LFEE course.   This course will be fully completed and complemented by the immersion course in France.  As a follow-up the teachers will confidently implement and teach French in accordance with the four capacities contained within the Scottish Curriculum for Excellence guidelines.

Also, they will ultimately share their learning with others whom they will train as future facilitators of French  to pupils throughout the school.  The techniques learned and used will be applied to other modern languages, such as Spanish since our pupils will be learning both languages.  This will include both teaching the language, culture and geography and historical aspects of France and Spain.  

A variety of methodologies and strategies will be used and in particular the use of ICT to enhance the learning and teaching of French.    We will continue to use the resources on the platform provided by LFEE which will ensure our use of ICT with the pupils.  We will use the methodology of active learning to involve and immerse our pupils in the language of French.   This will involve us making use of games, drama and songs, especially in the early stages of primary school where we will concentrate on the talking and listening of the modern language.  

As our pupils become more confident we will ensure that they are using the four language skills of talking, listening, reading and writing.  We will also follow the guidelines issued by Education Scotland that outlines exactly what material the pupils should be learning at each primary stage of school.  We will use West Lothian Progression Pathways to aid planning , teaching, learning and assessment.   Together, all of this will ensure that French is embedded into the life of our school.  Included in this are the parents who will be informed and given the opportunity to discover, shape and direct  their child's learning in this area.  At the same time, we intend to share our knowledge and good practice with other cluster schools in our network, other schools in Scotland via Education Scotland website and European colleagues via links established on immersion course and platform.

The project proposes an exchange between the three associations for young people with and without disabilities from Italy, Scotland and Germany.
The experience period will take place from July 28 to August 6 2017 in Turin, the city where "Si può fare" Association (the project leader) has its headquarters.
Participants will be in total 49 young people, some of them is with intellectual disabilities. The group-leaders are made up of 11 experts in the education of young people.
The issue addressed, which will guide all the activities proposed, is the psycho-physical well-being and includes several topics: good nutrition, sports, activities for inner well-being, respect and self-knowledge.
The choice to focus on well-being comes from the observation of groups of young people from the all three organizations, often not accustomed to reflect on themselves and the quality of the activities of their lives, on the general condition of their body and their mind.
The associations are working together since 2012 and from that year together are monitoring the people needs who dedicate their services. The exchange of 2016 was the time to discuss the observations made on the groups and there was a strong need for well-being, to take care of themselves in every aspect that composes the person.
The activities will be critical to improving feeling good about themselves: after a few ice-breaker games to create a good atmosphere among the participants, will alternate sports activities (where the Italian participants will be the main organizers, telling through sports that practice and accompanying the whole group to try it), cultural activities (museums for the city of Turin and discover its history), activities related to wellness (yoga in the morning or evening), the activities proposed to learn more about themselves and their limits (experiences to challenge the participant's fears), activities to continue to work on the knowledge of Italian culture, German and Scottish, activities related to health and nutrition.
The structure for the ten days is the Hostel OPEN 011 of the City of Turin, with 4 people rooms and halls where the groups could stay together for the activities.
For cooking and healthy eating activities we will use the Si può fare Association's spaces in 30 Fagnano street, multipurpose facility where participants could contribute to the preparation of the dinners.
The evaluation activities will be interim and final, designed to involve everyone and to reflect the best of what the exchange is doing arise in people.
The results expected at the end of the experience are the improvement of self-awareness, an increase in self-esteem and self-care. We expect greater willingness to do sports, in dealing with enjoyable activities for body and mind and a greater knowledge about balanced nutrition.
Be keen, go green! - Umwelt bewusst (er)leben!

Participants between the ages of 13 and 30 will focus on environmental awareness, sustainability, permaculture, recycling / upcycling, tolerance and environmental policy of the participating countries. The young people will learn to live in and around nature and how they can protect their environment in the long term. Since 2002 it's the project's aim to integrate young people with and without a disability into the group. They will grow more mature, as well as learning from each other and developing a feeling of togetherness. They will develop skills for their future lives, their environment and deal with people with disabilities, with their strengths and weaknesses. We want to deepen and strengthen what's been built by the youth programme so far.

Young people with physical disabilities or social disadvantages and young people without disabilities from Germany, Italy and Scotland will get to know each other by means of educational activities and cultural pedagogical offers, and explore their own physical and psychological boundaries as well as an intercultural exchange experience. In the social networks, on the websites of the participating organizations, on a blog and on flyers will inform about this youth exchange.
We want to make a common Europe experienceable, inspire young people to look beyond their own world for a while, and open their eyes for the opportunities awaiting them.

As a result of the Scottish Government's new policy 'Language Learning in Scotland: A 1+2 Approach' which will be fully implemented by 2020,  Simpson Primary School has initially enlisted the assistance of two teachers to participate in a SLC/LFEE course.   This course will be fully completed and complemented by the iollow up immersion course in France, (Montpellier).  As a follow-up the teachers will confidently implement and teach French in accordance with the four capacities contained within the Scottish Curriculum for Excellence guidelines.

Also, they will ultimately share their learning with others whom they will train as future facilitators of French  to pupils throughout the school.  The techniques learned and used will be applied to other modern languages, such as Spanish since our pupils will be learning both languages.  This will include both teaching the language, culture and geography and historical aspects of France and Spain.  

A variety of methodologies and strategies will be used and in particular the use of ICT to enhance the learning and teaching of French.    We will continue to use the resources on the platform provided by LFEE which will ensure our use of ICT with the pupils.  We will use the methodology of active learning to involve and immerse our pupils in the language of French.   This will involve us making use of games, drama and songs, especially in the early stages of primary school where we will concentrate on the talking and listening of the modern language.  

As our pupils become more confident we will ensure that they are using the four language skills of talking, listening, reading and writing.  We will also follow the guidelines issued by Education Scotland that outlines exactly what material the pupils should be learning at each primary stage of school.  We will use West Lothian Progression Pathways to aid planning , teaching, learning and assessment.   Together, all of this will ensure that French is embedded into the life of our school.  Included in this are the parents who will be informed and given the opportunity to discover, shape and direct  their child's learning in this area.  At the same time, we intend to share our further developed knowledge and good practice with other cluster schools in our network, other schools in Scotland via Education Scotland website and European colleagues via links established on immersion course and platform.

The project we are applying for is an LFEE Spanish one week immersion course to provide training for primary school teachers across Europe. The aims of the project are detailed below;

To improve methodological expertise in the teaching of Spanish to young learners
To provide participants with materials and ideas suitable for the teaching of Spanish at primary level
To develop cultural awareness and understanding of contemporary Spain
To improve participants’ competence and performance in Spanish
To use Internet and other ICT resources in your class

(source: LFEE.net)


We feel this project would be beneficial for our school because;

- More staff will be trained in effective teaching of modern languages bringing about greater confidence
- We will make strong connections with our European colleagues resulting in ongoing relationships to the benefit of both parties
- We will be better equipped with physical resources and also a wider array of ideas to support all learners across all ages and stages within primary school
- We will be confident in delivering the 1 plus 2 languages and integrating Spanish into daily classroom life
- We will share ideas in our own establishment and within our local cluster and community e.g. Spanish Cafe in school hall
- We will take suggestions from other schools
- We will have a developed understanding of European culture and will use this in our teaching practice
- It will further implement the 1 plus 2 language approach as outlined by Curriculum for Excellence
- It will raise awareness of European culture in a variety of ways
- It will improve language proficiency amongst pupils and staff
- It will broaden our knowledge of resources beneficial for our classroom environment
- It will improve the use of ICT within Spanish language teaching
- It will deeply enhance the early, first and second level teaching experiences across the school
- It will allow us to more confidently teach, model and observe Spanish lessons
- It will allow us to build on knowledge already received from PLL course
- We will make effective use of ICT opportunities such as Language Nut and Duolingo 

To summarise, we feel that we would be ideal candidates for the LFEE Spanish Immersion course. We are enthusiastic about developing our Spanish language and improving our competency and confidence in teaching Spanish. We are excited to experience Spanish and European culture first hand and we look forward to this project being a continuation of our learning journey.
Language Learning and Teaching at St. Anthony's Primary School

We value and promote the teaching of modern languages at St. Anthony's Primary school. As guidance from the Scottish Goverment and West Lothian council has now changed to the 1+2 Approach to Language Teaching, we are aware that we need to continue to update our methodology to move towards a whole-school Approach to Language Teaching. This approach will mean that language teaching is embedded in every class and delivered consistently by the class teacher rather than only during 1 session per week. In training staff from the infant, middle and upper stages, we hope to ensure consistency throughout the school. 

By training 4 members of staff in language and methodology of language teaching we are confident that we will be able to embed the target language into the school - French from Nursery upwards. This training and the teaching of language is a key part of our school improvement plan for 2018-19. The impact of the training will be fully evaluated by all staff on a quarterly basis. 

We hope that this training opportunity will enable us to implement the 1 + 2 Approach to Language Teaching to the highest possible standards. 

We look forward to empowering our pupils to communicate with pupils in the UK and abroad as a result of this training both in English and in the target language. We aim for our pupils to talk, listen, read and write with confidence in the target language and to be confident citizens of Europe.
